At this time, when there are persons, even among worldlings, who are willing to concede favors to us, let not the brethren of responsibility at 


                                    -275- 

the center of the work be slow to acknowledge the good work begun. Let them encourage the efforts of their fellow workers to plant the seeds of truth in new soil. Let them not be negligent or slack in sustaining these workers. When the Lord opens ways to establish small institutions in different places, let the men in positions of trust help their brethren to take advantage of these offers by advancing means to them, and giving them words of good cheer. Let not our leading brethren discourage God's servants from entering these providential openings.--Ms 154, 1902, pp. 1, 2. ("Our Opportunity to Work the Cities of America," October 24, 1902.)
